Hello Amara, what's the difference between alpha hydroxy acids and beta hydroxy acids?

Great question, Aaron! Alpha hydroxy acids (AHAs) are water-soluble acids that work on the surface of the skin, while beta hydroxy acids (BHAs) are oil-soluble acids that can penetrate deeper into the pores. AHAs are ideal for treating surface-level concerns like fine lines and sun damage, while BHAs are better suited for unclogging pores and treating acne and blemishes. As always, be sure to patch test any new products and consult a dermatologist if you have any concerns.
